newsitem.title: USA: New Mexico Four Corners 755 MW unit at full load.
newsitem.headline: New Mexico Four Corners 755 MW unit at full load.

text.p: The 755 megawatt (MW) unit 4 at the Four Corners coal-fired power plant in New Mexico reached full load Thursday afternoon after being shut Saturday to correct a fan problem, sources familiar with the unit said.
Meanwhile, the 187 MW unit 2 at the Four Corners plant was expected to restart Saturday morning after being shut Wednesday because of a tube leak.
Four Corners' 750 MW unit 5, 186 MW unit 1 and 244 MW unit 3 were said to be operating normally.
Arizona Public Service, which operates Four Corners, owns units 1, 2, and 3 along with 15 percent of units 4 and 5.
Southern California Edison Co holds a 48 percent stake in units 4 and 5.
